data.title: MacPherson MRT Station
authors: Contributors to Singapore MRT Lines Wiki
data.text:
About

MacPherson is a MRT Station located in Macpherson. It has five exits.

MacPherson MRT Station on the Circle Line has two platforms in an island platform arrangement. From the Circle Line platform, paid links are available to the Downtown Line platforms at both ends of the platform.

— MacPherson MRT Station at Land Transport Guru

MacPherson MRT Station on the Downtown Line has two platforms in a side platform arrangement with both platforms utilized for trains travelling in either direction. From the Downtown Line Platform, a paid link is available through lifts and escalators directly to the Circle Line Platforms.

— MacPherson MRT Station at Land Transport Guru

Both the Circle Line (Basement 1) and Downtown Line (Basement 2) station concourses feature faregates for automatic fare collection and provides access between paid and unpaid areas of the station, with at least one bidirectional wide-swinging gate for the benefit of passengers-in-wheelchairs and those carrying bulky items or travelling with prams. Unpaid links connect both Circle Line and Downtown Line concourses.

— MacPherson MRT Station at Land Transport Guru

Lines

Circle Line

It is an island platform in Circle Line. The station code number is CC10

Downtown Line

It is a side platform in Downtown Line. The station code number is DT26

CCL

A:For HarbourFront

B:For Dhoby Ghaut/Marina Bay

History

17 April 2010: Station opened with Circle Line CC10

21 October 2017: Opening of Downtown Line DT26

Art In Transit

Circle Line

Virtuous Cycle by Kay Kok Chung Oi: Virtuous Cycle signifies the symbolic meaning of Macpherson Station, portraying, the congregation of human dynamism and its cerebral energy, channelled and sustained by the ‘machinery’ of the station. The colourful arrows signify the public converging upon the Macpherson vicinity while the red rectangles represent Macpherson Station. The station performs the role of a conduit, connecting the populace to Macpherson, as well as celebrating the continuous vibrancy of the Macpherson community itself.

Downtown Line

Trail of Thoughts by Aminah Mohd Sa'at (Neng): ‘Trail of Thoughts‘ – a typographical installation within MacPherson station expressing the voices of the neighbourhood’s residents. Turning ordinary statements and phrases into larger-than-life typographical artwork, ‘Trail of Thoughts‘ draws attention to the often-missed daily sentiments and experiences of ordinary people. Th diverse ethnicity of the MacPherson neighbourhood is reflected through artwork rendered in Singapore’s four official languages – English, Mandarin, Malay and Tamil – inviting viewers to re-discover this uniqueness through artistic typography play.
